data.description: Join the world's largest HVAC company, named by Forbes as one of America's Best-In-State Employers 2025!Daikin Applied is now hiring an Energy Analyst Intern! Daikin Applied is a global leader in providing innovative HVAC solutions for commercial and industrial applications. We are currently seeking a highly motivated and detail-oriented Energy Analyst Intern to join our dynamic Controls team. This internship offers valuable hands-on experience in the field within a leading organization. Come be a part of an exciting journey at Daikin Applied, where innovation and excellence drive our every endeavor! Location: Remote, United States Timeline: This Internship opportunity is for May–August 2026 What’s in it for you: You will have the opportunity to own a meaningful, real-life project within the Southeast Region can directly create a positive impact on Daikin Applied’s HVAC Development An opportunity to build relationships with other students beyond your department The ability to make an impact and shape your career with a company that is passionate about growth The support of an organization that believes it is vital to include and engage diverse people, perspectives, and ideas to achieve our best What you will do: Work with energy and building performance data to track and compare energy usage across customer facilities. Support teams with data collection, analysis, and reporting to identify efficiency opportunities. Gain experience in evaluating building performance and understanding how to qualify projects. Contribute to organization and documentation efforts that help engineering and service teams. Participate in training to develop energy benchmarking and assessment skills. Collaborate with teams to translate findings into actionable insights for customers. Minimum Qualifications: Pursuing a bachelor degree with a target graduation of 2027 or 2028 Complete or currently enrolled in coursework with engineering, building science, math, physics or other related fields Proficiency in the Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, PowerPoint, and Word) Work visa sponsorship is not available for this position Preferred Qualifications Interest in the basics of mechanical/electrical systems enough to communicate with engineers Experience in data sets, spreadsheets, and reporting Reside within 100 miles of Tampa, FL The typical hourly pay rate for this position is $22/hr - $25/hr. This represents the pay range for all positions in the job grade which this position falls. Individual base pay will depend on a wide range of factors including your skills, qualifications, experience, and location. If you're looking for an engaging career with growth opportunities in a supportive environment, you'll love a career at Daikin Applied!
